document_data.name: Venturer's Rest
document_data.mainbody:
The '''Venturer's Rest''', previously known as the '''Old Dirty Dwarf''',{{Template:Cite book/Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide|85}}

{{Quote|I assure you, that establishment is not named for anyone I know|[[Satarin|Brother Satarin]], on the Old Dirty Dwarf Inn.}}
document_data.Structure:
From the exterior, the inn appeared as hole-in-the-wall establishment of little acclaim. It was tucked away in an unremarkable corner of the city, built into the side of the Hold's numerous stone archways that passed over its stone streets.

The only noteworthy feature outside the inn simple wooden sign upon which was scrawled the crude likeness of a [[mug]] of [[ale]].

Interior.Atmosphere: Its taproom offered ample seating and featured grand hearth that contributed to a relaxing environment.

document_data.Services:
When it operated under the name of the Old Dirty Dwarf, the inn and tavern was considered to be the finest in all of Helm's Hold. The proprietor [[Juetta Bealcrest|Juetta]] was particularly welcoming, catering to those individuals that were new to the city.{{Template:Cite book/Neverwinter Campaign Setting|168}} Quite unfortunately the Dwarf did not cater to any [[spellscarred]] citizens of the city.

By the {{yearlinkName|1489}}, the renamed Venturer's Rest had become a favored stop for [[adventurer]]s that were staying at Helm's Hold.
document_data.History:
While many businesses in Helm's Hold were forced to close down during difficult years that plagued Helm's Hold in the latter half of the 15{{th}} century, the Old Dirty Dwarf stood strong.

When the Prophet [[Rohini]] rose to power in the Helm's Hold some time before the {{yearlinkName|1479}}, the inn became a point of interest for her [[foulspawn]] agents. They monitored all the out-of-towners who passed through its doors and reported their findings to their [[devil]]ish leader.

During the [[Siege of Helm's Hold]] that same year, the inn was used as a base of operations by Councilwoman [[Alisara Callum]] during her efforts to aid the reclamation of the city.

Years after the Prophet's demise, sometime between [[1485 DR|1485]] and [[1489 DR]], the Old Dirty Dwarf came under the ownership of [[Kharissa Anuvien]], a [[paladin]] of [[Chauntea]] who was new to the city. She gave the inn the more dignified name the Venturer's Rest and it remained a favored establishment for the people of Helm's Hold.
